puns.name: Geometry
puns.description: What did the triangle say to the circle? “You are pointless

puns.name: Multiplication and Division
puns.description: Why did the student do multiplication problems on the floor? The teacher told him not to use tables.

puns.name: Counting
puns.description: A talking sheepdog rounds up all the sheep into the pen for his farmer. He comes back and says, “Okay, Chief — all 40 sheep accounted for”. The farmer says, “But I have counted them and I have only got 36!” The sheepdog replies, “I know, but I rounded them up.”

puns.name: Fractions
puns.description: There is a fine line between a numerator and a denominator… But only a fraction would understand.

puns.name: Statistics
puns.description: A statistician got soaking wet trying to cross a river. He thought he could cross, because it was one-foot deep on average.

puns.name: Algebra
puns.description: Why did the boy refuse to drink the water with eight ice cubes in it? Because it is too cubed!

puns.name: Pi
puns.description: Who was the roundest knight at King Arthur table? Sir Cumference. How did he get so round? He ate too many 'π’s'.
